column1: A lymphangiogram is a special x-ray of the lymph nodes and lymph vessels.
Instead of injecting blue dye between your toes, your doctor may numb the skin over your groin and then insert a thin needle under ultrasound guidance into a lymph node in your groin.
The health care provider uses the images to follow the dye as it spreads through the lymphatic system up your legs, groin, and along the back of the abdominal cavity.
Contrast dye and x-rays are used to help determine the cause of swelling in an arm or leg and check for diseases that may be caused by parasites.
